title: mistakes were made
body: i noticed every time i try to carry a game, 9 times out of 10 ill lose. so i started maining support. i tried playing support the same way i play any other lane, aggro , and as a result, i would lose those games too.....i tried a different approach...playing safe and focusing only on farming. guess what, i started winning games. how could this work? if i dont have 99999 kills, then i cant carry games... what about gold .-. gold helps you buy items. by improving my farm and caring less about kills, i died less, thus letting me stay in lane getting more xp and more gold. i let my teammates carry me.. i didnt have to do anything but stay back and keep up with farm and not die. i applied this to support, just letting my adc farm and only engaging when the other team would fuck up. got me from b5 to s2 last season. maybe some of you lower elo people should try it :D just sit back and farm and let the elo come to you

replies.body:
cuz you dont do shit with your kills
then you dont win, simple as that

farming endlessly is pretty much what good split pushers do
for some reason the rest of the team insists on NOT farming, and walks around with no direction and purpose just waiting to get fking killed >.>
low elo mentality: im fed i can 1v5. i dont support thaat mentality.

Although frankly put, kills can be better than farm. Farming, overall, usually gives more gold than killing but killing isn't only about the gold you receive but the gold/exp the enemy DOESN'T receive while dead. 

Doing things with your kills doesn't mean 1v5, it means helping other lanes, making effects in teamfights, and keeping enemies down.
